description: Try our easy to follow Slow-Roasted Lamb recipe. Absolutely delicious with the best ingredients from Woolworths.
keywords: Roast lamb,Roast,Seafood free,Gluten free,Tree nut free,Lamb,Egg free,Sesame free,Potato,Father's Day,Wheat free,Tomato,Easter,Peanut free
name: Slow-Roasted Lamb Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 2 red capsicums, deseeded, cut into 5cm pieces
3 limes, juiced and rind finely grated
285g fire-roasted whole peppers, drained, seeds removed
1kg white washed potatoes, peeled (for mashed potato)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine oil, 3 tsp Cajun seasoning, lime rind, 1 tbs lime juice and garlic in a bowl. Lay lamb into a roasting pan and cut small slits all over the surface. Rub seasoning mix over lamb and push into the cuts. Pour 1/2 cup water into roasting pan and cover pan tightly with foil. Roast for 21/2 hours.
Meanwhile, process peppers, sour cream and the remaining lime juice and Cajun seasoning in a food processor until smooth. Chill until ready to serve.

Remove foil from lamb. Add tomato, capsicum and onion to roasting pan with lamb and roast, uncovered, for a further 35 minutes or until tender. Transfer lamb to a large plate and cover with foil to keep warm. Allow meat to rest for 10 minutes. Cover vegetables and keep warm while lamb is resting.

Cut potatoes into evenly sized pieces. Place in a medium saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring to the boil over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, for 20-25 minutes or until soft when tested in the centre with a skewer. Drain. Return potato to saucepan and shake gently over low heat for 1 minute to dry.
Heat milk and cream together in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Mash potato with a masher. Add hot milk mixture, butter, 2 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp white pepper. Mash until potato mixture is lump free, then beat well with a wooden spoon until smooth.
Slice lamb. Serve with vegetables, mashed potato and pepper sauce.
